member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.EndConstructGeneration.EndConstructStatementVisitor.TryApplyOnForStatement(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.StatementSyntax)
member.param: The ForStatementSyntax or ForEachStatementSyntax for the loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.EndConstructGeneration.EndConstructStatementVisitor.ConvertSingleLineStatementsToMultiLineStatements(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxList{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.StatementSyntax},System.String)
member.summary: Given a separatedSyntaxList of statements separated by colons, converts them to a separate syntax list of statements separated by newlines
member.param: The list of statements to convert.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.EndConstructGeneration.EndConstructStatementVisitor.NeedsGetAccessor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.PropertyStatementSyntax,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.AccessorBlockSyntax)
member.summary: Given a property declaration, determines if a Get accessor needs to be generated. This checks to see if any getters already exist.
member.param: An existing getter to ignore. When we are checking for existing getters, we might be in the middle of typing one that would be a false positive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.EndConstructGeneration.EndConstructStatementVisitor.NeedsSetAccessor(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.PropertyStatementSyntax,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.AccessorBlockSyntax)
member.summary: Given a property declaration, determines if a Set accessor needs to be generated. This checks to see if any getters already exist.
member.param: An existing getter to ignore. When we are checking for existing getters, we might be in the middle of typing one that would be a false positive.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.KeywordHighlighting.ForLoopBlockHighlighter.GetNextStatementMatchingForBlock(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.ForOrForEachBlockSyntax)
member.summary: Find the Next statement that closes this For block (if one exists). Normally that would just be the one associated with forBlock, but if we have a "Next a, b" statement that is closing multiple loops, the Next statement is attached to the innermost matching loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.KeywordHighlighting.ForLoopBlockHighlighter.GetForBlocksMatchingNextStatement(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.VisualBasic.Syntax.NextStatementSyntax)
member.summary: Returns all For blocks logically matching the Next statement, ordered from outermost to innermost. Do not consider the actual names of the loop variables because highlighting should work even if the wrong identifier names are listed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitBufferManager
member.summary: This class watches for buffer-based events, tracks the dirty regions, and invokes the formatter as appropriate

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitBufferManager._dirtyState
member.summary: The tracking span which is the currently "dirty" region in the buffer. May be null if there is no dirty region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitBufferManager._suppressions
member.summary: The number of times BeginSuppressingCommits() has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitBufferManager.CommitDirty(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Commits any dirty region, if one exists.
To improve perf, passing false to isExplicitFormat will avoid semantic checks when expanding the formatting span to an entire block

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitBufferManager.BeginSuppressingCommits
member.summary: Suppresses future commits, causing all calls to CommitDirty() to be a simple no-op, even if there is a dirty span.
member.returns: An IDisposable that should be disposed when the caller wants to resume submissions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitCommandHandler
member.summary: Watches for the enter key being pressed, and triggers a commit in response.
member.remarks: This particular command filter acts as a "wrapper" around any other command, as it wishes to invoke the commit after whatever processed the enter is done doing what it's doing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.CommitViewManager
member.summary: This class watches for view-based events in relation to a specific subject buffer and passes along commit operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineCommit.ContainingStatementInfo.GetInfo(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This function returns the "logical" statement that a given point is in. "Logical" in this case means "the smallest unit the user probably thinks as a statement", or "the thing we should format when you leave it."

Commits a region by formatting and case correcting it. It is assumed that an ITextUndoTransaction is open the underlying text buffer, as multiple edits may be done by this function. Further, if the operation is cancelled, the buffer may be left in a partially committed state that must be rolled back by the transaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineSeparators.VisualBasicLineSeparatorService.IsSeparableBlock(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNodeOrToken)
member.summary: Node types that are interesting for line separation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineSeparators.VisualBasicLineSeparatorService.IsSeparableContainer(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxNode)
member.summary: Node types that may contain separable blocks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineSeparators.VisualBasicLineSeparatorService.GetLineSeparatorsAsync(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Document,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Given a syntaxTree returns line separator spans. The operation may take fairly long time on a big syntaxTree so it is cancellable.

member.name: M:Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Editor.VisualBasic.LineSeparators.VisualBasicLineSeparatorService.ProcessNodeList``1(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxTree,Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.SyntaxList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.Text.TextSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: If node is separable and not the last in its container => add line separator after the node If node is separable and not the first in its container => ensure separator before the node last separable node in Program needs separator after it.
Creates the left-hand entry and right-hand entries for a list of events.
member.param: The type that contains the methods attached to the events. For items that will generate new methods, they will be generated into this class.
The type to list the events of. This is either equal to containingType if it's listing the event handlers for the base types, or else it's the type of the eventContainer.
If this is an entry for a WithEvents member, the WithEvents property itself.
